meanings.definition: To agree to give or allow (something requested) to
meanings.sent1: I will grant you permission to go to the park.
meanings.sent2: The teacher will grant an extension on the homework deadline.
meanings.sent3: I will grant you three wishes, but be careful what you wish for!
meanings.sent4: Her smile granted me the courage to speak up in class.
meanings.sent5: The key to success is to grant yourself the freedom to make mistakes.

meanings.definition: A sum of money given by an organization, especially a government, for a particular purpose
meanings.sent1: She received a grant to conduct research on endangered species.
meanings.sent2: The government provided a grant to support small businesses during the pandemic.
meanings.sent3: The grant for the new playground equipment made the children very happy.
meanings.sent4: The grant was a lifeline for the struggling non-profit organization.
meanings.sent5: The grant enabled the school to upgrade its technology infrastructure.
